title: Republicans take control of US House of Representatives
description: Republicans won the 218 seats needed to control House, securing a slim majority that will complicate the party’s ability to govern.

title: Rio-Paris crash trial: Airbus blames 'pilot errors'
description: According to the group's line of defense, the icing of the Pitot probes during the fatal flight of June 1, 2009, was manageable, but the crew did not know how to react to this event.

title: COP27: Lula promises to protect the Amazon
description: Brazil's president-elect vowed to crack down on illegal deforestation and rebuild relationships with countries financing the protection of the rainforest.

title: Protests over Covid-19 lockdown in Guangzhou
description: Despite China's announcement of a more targeted approach to the zero Covid policy, the city of Guangzhou has declared a total lockdown for one district.

title: Luxurious World Cup base camps have not always brought France joy
description: The French team is staying at a five-star hotel in Doha, but it has had mixed fortunes with its base camps in past competitions.

title: US Supreme Court clears way for Arizona execution
description: Murray Hooper was convicted for a 1980 double murder and is scheduled to die by lethal injection, in what will be the state's third execution this year.

title: 'Space can help us meet the challenges of climate change'
description: Director of the European Space Agency Josef Aschbacher and astronaut Thomas Pesquet explain how satellites can help with the management of water, energy and agriculture.

title: Wave of violence grips Martinique: 'Weapons are the island's scourge'
description: The French Caribbean island has recorded 25 homicides since the beginning of the year, with officials saying that weapons find their way too easily on to the island.

title: Wives and mothers of conscripted Russian soldiers demand their return from the front
description: They may not be questioning the 'special operation,' but videos in which family members point out the army's lack of organization have embarrassed authorities.

title: Should we acknowledge that limiting global warming to 1.5°C is no longer possible?
description: Over 1,000 scientists from nearly 50 countries have raised this troubling question by stating that it is 'no longer defensible' to publicly say that such a possibility is 'still alive.'

title: Attacks against asylum seekers on the rise again in Germany
description: In a climate of social anxiety driven by rising inflation, three shelters housing asylum seekers and refugees suffered arson attacks in the last two weeks of October alone.

title: G20 steps up pressure on Russia, despite divisions over Ukraine war
description: The world's major economic powers released a joint statement condemning the use of nuclear weapons and stressing the effect of the conflict on the global economy.

title: Qatar World Cup: France captain Lloris will not wear anti-discrimination armband
description: Unlike the captains of 10 other European nations playing at the world cup, Hugo Lloris will not wear the multi-colored OneLove heart.

title: How escalation was avoided after a deadly missile blast in Poland
description: A missile exploded 6 kilometers from the Ukrainian border, raising the specter of a regional escalation. Western leaders were careful not to incriminate Moscow, which massively bombed Ukraine the same day.

title: Macron urges China to play 'greater mediation role' on Ukraine
description: Speaking at the G20 summit in Bali, the French president told his Chinese counterpart on Wednesday that he can play a greater role in pushing Russia towards de-escalation in Ukraine.

title: The French army is preparing for high-intensity war
description: Citing changing geopolitical relations and the 'prospect of a major conflict,' the French army will begin a large-scale exercise in 2023, involving some   20,000 soldiers.

title: Paris property tax hike stuns local politics
description: The conservative opposition is furious about Mayor Anne Hidalgo's sudden decision, which went further than even her allies were asking for.

title: Donald Trump announces run for 2024 presidential election, dreaming of being an outsider again
description: The former US president tried to recreate the chemistry of 2016: one man against the elites. But after disappointing midterm elections, the energy is not quite there among Republicans.

title: Grammys 2023: Beyonce dominates music awards with nine nominations
description: The prestigious Grammy Awards are set to take place on Sunday, February 5, with Beyonce leading the nominations with nine, followed by Kendrick Lamar with eight and Adele with seven.

title: US Artemis mission sets out to conquer the Moon again
description: After two hurricanes and numerous technical issues, the world's most powerful rocket blasted off to the moon unmanned on Wednesday.

title: UK inflation hits 11.1%, a four-decade high, on the back of soaring energy prices
description: After millions of British households were hit hard by rising energy bills and an escalating cost of living, the UK's soaring inflation is even higher than feared and hits the poorest families the hardest.

title: The return of the Taliban to hardline Sharia law
description: The Taliban supreme leader has ordered Afghan judges to rigorously apply Islamic law, while the exclusion of women from public spaces continues.

title: Artemis I: NASA's mightiest rocket blasts off to the moon
description: After years of delays and setbacks, the uncrewed Artemis I mission launched into deep space around the Moon on Wednesday, in preparation for humanity's return to the lunar surface fifty years after Apollo.

title: NATO envoys to meet after explosion in Poland sparks concern among world leaders
description: Poland's military has been put on alert following the missile strike which killed two people. US President Joe Biden said it was 'unlikely' the missile was fired from Russia.

title: 'China is not an inconsequential industrial partner'
description: Looking at the example of German car manufacturers, researchers François Chimits and Gregor Sebastian warn European manufacturers not to be overly dependent on China.

title: 'The third political force in Israel represents what we must reluctantly call 'Jewish fascism''
description: While Benyamin Netanyahu is a 'conventional' right-wing populist, his new partner in the coalition, Itamar Ben-Gvir, is 'beyond populism,' claiming violence as a legitimate recourse to defend 'the land, the nation and God,' explains Franco-Israeli sociologist Eva Illouz in an op-ed in 'Le Monde.'

title: Infertility, a 'major public health issue' neglected by public authorities
description: In France, one in four couples of childbearing age is affected by infertility, according to a report submitted in February to the Ministry of Health.

title: Musk delays Twitter relaunch after fake account frenzy
description: Twitter's new owner postponed the relaunch of the site's paid subscription service on Tuesday after authentic-looking fake accounts proliferated on the website, throwing his plans into chaos.

title: 'America's comeback starts right now': Trump launches 2024 White House bid
description: After disappointing midterms, widely blamed on the underperformance of Trump-anointed candidates, some Republicans are openly asking whether the former president is the right person to carry the party colors in 2024.

title: Halfway through COP27, climate negotiations have only made marginal progress
description: There is a serious danger of seeing a retreat from the need to limit global warming to 1.5°C. India is pushing for a commitment at COP27 to phase out all fossil fuels.

title: Russia fuels exceptional energy crisis in Moldova
description: The pro-European Moldovan government is under significant pressure from Moscow, while the pro-Russian opposition is accused of trying to overthrow the government.

title: 'Three dead' as Iran protests swell on anniversary of lethal 2019 crackdown
description: Rights group Hengaw accused Iranian security forces of having shot dead at least three protesters on Tuesday. Protesters were responding to a call to commemorate those slain in the 2019 crackdown.
